conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the relationship between position and time using the graph and calculate acceleration.
The graph shows a linear relationship between position x and the square of time t², indicating x is directly proportional to t².
The position x is proportional to t², expressed as x = (1/2) * t².
Find velocity v by taking the derivative of x with respect to time t, resulting in v = t.
Acceleration a is the derivative of velocity v with respect to time t, so a = dv/dt = 1.
The magnitude of the acceleration is 1 m/s².
